intro: Hedyphylla vulgaris, commonly known as the common hedyphylla, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with lance-shaped leaves that are slightly hairy. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It prefers well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it suitable for garden cultivation. Hedyphylla vulgaris is noted for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
